Talk_0056:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I'm going back to work now, Rhondson.
But don't worry, I'll try to think of
something nice to do for <clr:0000>Mattison<clr:ffff>.
Talk_0162: <sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:TalkPositive_01>Hey, everyone. Take a look at that.
Talk_0057:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_00>We're still not ready to open for business.
My husband and I have been very busy
preparing to send our daughter off.
Talk_0058:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Sav'orq, that's it! I'll be saying sav'orq to
Papa and Mama soon, so I gotta study
my less-sons as much as I can.
Talk_0202:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:LaughS_01>Now, I've got to get back to work.
Don't you have a customer waiting
for you, dear?
Talk_0059:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:LaughL>For this less-son, I'm going to be giving a
<clr:0000>Gerudo quiz<clr:ffff>. You should try it.
Talk_0165:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Hmmm...bright yellow <clr:0000>sundelions<clr:ffff>...


You know, if it was attached to those
ruins that fell from up above, then maybe
there's a flower field in the <clr:0000>sky<clr:ffff>.
Talk_0203:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:LaughS_01>I've got to be getting back to work.
We need to start accepting requests
for <clr:0000>dream homes <clr:ffff>again.
Talk_0204:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:LaughS_01>Go become a wonderful vai, and come
back with lots of stories to tell.

I can't wait to hear about your
adventures!
Talk_0206:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>OK. It's done. <sp:5:0:0>It's already morning, eh?
Guess that took a whole day.
Talk_0060: <sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Sad_01>Hudson! You've got to get it together!
Talk_0169:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:TalkPositive_00>It's blessing the start of your
journey, Mattison.
Talk_0061:
<sp:3:0:2:0801>I'm about to go give a less-son to <clr:0000>Granny<clr:ffff>
<clr:0000>Monari<clr:ffff>. You should come too!

After some instruct-sons from me, you'll
be speaking Gerudo in no time.
Talk_0208:
<sp:3:0:2:0a01><snd:Wakeup>I'm sleepy, but I can't rest until I
see Papa...
Talk_0062:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>I'm getting tired, so I have to say
good night now...<sp:5:0:0>

<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:LaughS>But when I wake up, I'm going to give a
less-son to <clr:0000>Granny Monari<clr:ffff>. You should
come with me, if you're interested!
After some instruct-sons from me, you'll
be speaking Gerudo in no time!
Talk_0170:
<sp:3:0:2:0001><snd:TalkPositive_00>We'll be touching down soon. Hold
on tight.
Talk_0102: <sp:3:0:2:0800>Papa, your present made me very happy!
Talk_0171:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:LaughS_01>Oh, Mattison, don't make such a ruckus.
You do not want to fall from this height.
Talk_0066:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Hehe, of course! And it's a special
occas-son too, because a new student
is joining the class!
Talk_0172:
<sp:3:0:2:0001>Then again, maybe she won't have to.


Ever since Hagie was put in charge of the
railcar, it's become a whole lot harder
to catch a ride.
Talk_0104:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>Whether you're in Gerudo Town or Tarrey
Town, never forget that we are all
standing beneath the very same sun.
Talk_0067:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting>Oh my, you're in a good mood today,
Mattison. Is it time for another lesson?
Talk_0173:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>I wonder if any of them are growing
somewhere...
Talk_0105:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>Mattison...<sp:5:1:0>you know...<sp:5:0:0>if you get lonely,
you can come back any—<sp:5:1:0>
Talk_0068:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Sad_00>Sorry. I've got to go. <sp:5:1:0>We're kinda busy
right now.
Talk_0174:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00><snd:Wakeup>I'm so sleepy.<sp:5:1:0> Let's do the less-son...<sp:5:1:0>
*yawn*<sp:5:0:0> when I wake up...
Talk_0175:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Sleep>Listen, we'll do the Gerudo quiz...<sp:5:1:0> when
I wake up...<sp:5:0:0>OK?
Talk_0107:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:LaughS_00>The only distance that matters is the
distance between our hearts.<sp:5:0:0> So you see,
your mama will always be beside you.
Talk_0108:
<sp:3:0:2:0900><snd:Angry_00>Don't frighten me like that! For a second,
I thought you were here to take me away
on my big journey.
Talk_0176:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Granny Monari isn't here yet. We
gotta wait.
Talk_0177:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>It's like Mattison said...the <clr:0000>sundelion<clr:ffff>
she saw was attached to fallen ruins.

So it could be they don't grow down here
on the ground.
Talk_0109:
<sp:3:0:2:0100>Sorry...<sp:5:0:0>never mind.<sp:5:1:0> Papa needs to be
strong just like you.

My little Mattison...<sp:5:1:0>it's time for you to go
on your big adventure.
TerrorImpulse_02: How did it even get there?
Talk_0178:
But if you ever visit <clr:0000>Gerudo Town<clr:ffff>, please
check in on Mattison.
Talk_0179:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I've gotta go home and study all
my less-sons.
Talk_0110:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>Gerudo Town is pretty far from here,
and there are plenty of monsters along
the way.
So, I thought I'd make Mattison her own
special air balloon!
Talk_0180:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Hmm, I think the word for rain is...


<sp:3:0:2:0800>Oh! It's zaa'va! I love learning
Gerudo pronunciat-son!
Talk_0112:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:QuestionNormal_00>If it's a trip on the railcar you're after,<sp:5:0:0>
I'll tell ya what I tell everyone else!<sp:5:1:0>
No rupees, no ride!
Talk_0181: Boys are vai, and girls are...voe?<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:QuestionNormal_01>Wait...that's wrong, isn't it?
Near_0007: What am I going to do?
Talk_0113:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Hey! You didn't ment-son you were
coming here too, mister!

It's strange... Papa keeps mumbling to
himself, "hmm, hmm, hmmm."
Talk_0182:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>You're right, of course. It's a special
journey. And we should do something
big for her.
Talk_0076: <sp:3:0:2:0700>OK, let's see how you do this time!
Talk_0114:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Greeting_01>Special or not, I love the balloon you
made, Papa. It looks like the sun!
Talk_0183:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy_00>What's this? You found them all for us?
Looks like I'll have no problem dyeing the
balloon the color of the sun.
Talk_0116: <sp:3:0:2:0700>And, well, <sp:5:1:0>what I came up with is this.
Talk_0184:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>Awww, I wasn't any help at all. I failed
my miss-son.
Talk_0117: <sp:3:0:2:0800>I did it! My miss-son was a success!
Talk_0185:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Happy_01>That's not true, Mattison.<sp:0:4:0>Your papa is about to turn this balloon
into the sun, isn't he?

I know, why don't you help me with that?
Talk_0187:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>I will! I will, Papa! I'll help you make
the sun!
Talk_0188:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>At last. It's done. And morning is
already here.
Talk_0189:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>I'm just happy I get to watch my little one
sleep a bit longer.
Talk_0120:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Ding, ding, ding!<sp:5:1:0> That's right!


You're doing really good! Maybe you've
done this before?
Talk_0082:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>I want to ride the railcar so I can get to
Papa's construct-son site and help him
get his work done.
But I forgot that guy won't give me
permiss-son to ride unless I pay him.
Talk_0121:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy_00>Ah, yes. Vaba. It was on the tip of
my tongue.
Talk_0083:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Papa is always busy, so I'm going to the
construct-son site to help him!
Talk_0122:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:TalkPositive>OK now, pay attent-son, Granny Monari.<sp:5:1:0>
It's time for Mattison's Gerudo quiz!
Talk_0084:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>"Granny" in Gerudo is, eh... Hmm...
What was it...
Near_0017: We have to wait just a bit.
Talk_0085:
<sp:3:0:2:0001>Listen! You gotta hurry so you don't get
soaked the rain!
Talk_0123:
<sp:3:0:2:0801>Yay! I can finally get to Papa. OK, I'm off!


He's gonna be so happy to see me!
Talk_0191:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Notice_01>Oh, Rhondson! What's wrong?<sp:5:1:0> No, don't
tell me—
Talk_0124:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:LaughL_00>Nope! Too bad! And Granny Monari is out
of time too!
Talk_0086:
<sp:3:0:2:0900>Whoa, hey now, what do you think you're
doing?! You know I can see you, right?

Bringing that over here like that—you're
interfering with my business!
Talk_0192:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Ease_00>Yes. Her escort has arrived and is waiting
at the village entrance.
Talk_0125:
<sp:3:0:2:0801>Well, now there's one more Gerudo
speaker around here!

Thanks to Mattison, I've grown rather
knowledgeable about the language
myself, you know.
Talk_0087:
<sp:3:0:2:0900>Wh-what is this?! It's right in my way.
Can't see a thing...
Talk_0193:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Let's all go together, then. In Mattison's
special sun balloon!
Talk_0126:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I took lots of notes about what Mama
taught me. In fact, I have 'em all written
down in a <clr:0000>book<clr:ffff>.
<sp:3:0:2:0a01>I suppose Mama does get pretty grumpy
with me when I make a mess of the <clr:0000>desk<clr:ffff>.

<sp:3:0:2:0801>But then, when she hears me speak
Gerudo, she gets really happy! That's
the rea-son I love studying so much.
Talk_0088:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>The sun...<sp:5:1:0>


<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy_01>That's it! Let's color it yellow like
the sun.

<sp:3:0:2:0701>I've seen <clr:0000>sundelions<clr:ffff> around here. I could
use them to make a dye. Bet I'd get a
beautiful shade of yellow from them.
But for me to dye something this size,
I'd need <clr:0000><sp:2:e:44:3e0049006300680069006b006100720061004300680061006c006c0065006e0067006500300031005f0048006900640061006d006100720069004e0075006d00ffff00cd> <clr:ffff>of them.
Talk_0194:
<snd:Humming>♪Quick and quality, blink and
we're done!♪
Talk_0127: <sp:3:0:2:0701>Do you two want to give it another try?
Talk_0089:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:TalkPositive_01>You need <clr:0000>sundelions<clr:ffff>, Papa? Those are
the bright yellow flowers, right?

I'll make finding them my new miss-son!
Talk_0128:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>But...I want to make it really special.
Something just for her. I'm just...not
sure how to do that.
Talk_0196:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting_00>What are you talking about? Have you
forgotten that voe aren't allowed in
Gerudo Town?
Talk_0129:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>I've got it!<sp:0:4:0>Papa is always sooo busy, so I'll just make
it my miss-son to help him with his work!

OK! I'm gonna go ride the <clr:0000>railcar <clr:ffff>to the
<clr:0000>job site<clr:ffff> where he does all his work.
Talk_0197: <sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Notice_01>Ah, right. I guess it slipped my mind.
Talk_0198:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:TalkPositive_01>You can trust me. I'll take care of your
papa and mama. Don't worry, you can go.
Talk_0090:
<sp:3:0:2:0400><snd:QuestionNormal_00>I appreciate the thought, but it's much too
difficult. Sundelions are quite rare.

I'm not even sure where you'd find them.
Talk_0199:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy_01>I'll come visit you in Gerudo Town
sometime. When I do, let's play again!
Talk_0091:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Happy_01>Don't worry! I've seen a sundelion before.
It was attached to the ruins that fell from
the sky.
Talk_0130: <sp:3:0:2:0800>Thanks for helping me with my miss-son!
Talk_0092:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>That ought to do it.<sp:0:4:0>You can bet I'll be sending a bill to
Hudson for cleaning up that mess.
Talk_0093: <sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:Sad>I want to get to my Papa...but I can't.
Talk_0131:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Sad_01>But...<sp:5:1:0><clr:0000>the railcar isn't where it should be<clr:ffff>.<sp:0:4:0>I need it so I can get to Papa's
construct-son site and help him.
Talk_0132:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:LaughL_01>Hehe, well, it's how they talk in Mama's
hometown. So if every-son can talk like
that here, well...
Then Mama won't be so lonesome, right?


<sp:3:0:2:0c00>I feel better knowing Mama will be OK.
But now I need to think of a way to help
Papa.<sp:5:0:0> Hmmm...
Talk_0133:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Think_01>Oh, Mattison. She's had to grow up
too quickly.

At her age, she should be clinging to her
mama and papa's legs, not working up a
sweat trying to make sure they're happy.
Talk_0134:
<sp:3:0:2:0a01><snd:Sad_01>I need the <clr:0000>railcar<clr:ffff> to get to Papa's
construct-son site so I can help him.

Where is it? Did it leave without me?
Talk_0096:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Happy_01>I'm kinda nervous about it, but...<sp:5:1:0>I trust
you. I'll run straight there!
Talk_0135:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Sad_01>But...<sp:5:1:0>the path to the railcar is <clr:0000>blocked<clr:ffff>.<clr:0000><clr:ffff>


There's no way I can get on the railcar
when things are like this.
Talk_0097:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Oh, it's you. <sp:5:1:0>So, you know, I've been
doing a lot of thinking...

Trying to figure out what I could possibly
do for Mattison.
Talk_0098:
<sp:3:0:2:0001>Listen! You gotta watch out for the
lightning! If it hit you, it'd hurt a lot.
Talk_0136: <sp:3:0:2:0a00>I never had to pay until he took over.
Talk_0137:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>Guess I'm gonna have to hop aboard the
railcar <clr:0000>without him noticing<clr:ffff>.

<sp:3:0:2:0a01>But how am I gonna do that all by myself?


What I need is for someone to maybe
<clr:0000>cover his eyes <clr:ffff>or something.
Talk_0099:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>I've got to ride the railcar if I'm gonna
get to Papa's job site and help him out!

But I forgot that guy won't let me ride it
unless I pay him money.

<sp:3:0:2:0900>Guess I'm just gonna have to find a
way to sneak on the railcar <clr:0000>without
him noticing<clr:ffff>.
<sp:3:0:2:0a01>But how am I going to do that?<sp:5:1:0> Wish
I could get someone to maybe <clr:0000>cover
his eyes <clr:ffff>for me.
Talk_0139:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Sad_00>Yes. You did great.


She didn't cry, so it's good we didn't
cry either.
Talk_0140:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Sad_01>Yes. <sp:5:1:0>You're right, of course...<sp:5:1:0> Ahem...<sp:5:1:0>
OK, I am...<sp:5:1:0>ready.
Talk_0035:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>We were so deep in conversation, we
hardly made time for you earlier. Sorry
about that.
You know, here at <clr:0000>Hudson Construction<clr:ffff>
we like to say...<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0800><sp:0:2:2:7d00>"It's son and done!"<sp:0:2:2:6400><sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0701>And here I am, president of the company.
I'm supposed to be strong and decisive.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0a00>But when it comes to my own <clr:0000>child<clr:ffff>, I feel
so...<sp:5:0:0>unsure about things.
Talk_0141:
<sp:3:0:2:0300><snd:Sad_00>Rhondson...did I manage to keep a smile
on my face?
Talk_0036:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_00>Just yesterday, she was talking about it
happily. Perhaps you're overthinking it?

Though I do understand. I know you're
worried about <clr:0000>Mattison moving<clr:ffff>...
Talk_0142:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>Now,<sp:5:0:0> this is the start of a new life for
us too.

<snd:Greeting_00>Let's pull ourselves together...<sp:5:1:0>if
you're ready?
Talk_0037:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Think>Monari told me that <clr:0000>Mattison<clr:ffff> has been
acting real cheerful lately.

I can't help but wonder if she's...you
know...just putting on a bold face. After
all, she's <clr:0000>going to be picked up<clr:ffff> soon.
Talk_0038:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Sad_00>Please, if you keep acting like this, it will
only make it more difficult for <clr:0000>Mattison<clr:ffff>
to leave.
This is a once-in-a-lifetime journey for a
Gerudo. We should support her and give
her a grand send-off!
Talk_0039:
<sp:0:2:2:7d00><sp:3:0:2:0b01><snd:QuestionNormal_00>Ah! <sp:5:1:0>A customer?!<sp:5:1:0><sp:0:2:2:6400><sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0701>Welcome to <clr:0000>Hudson Construction<clr:ffff>!<sp:5:0:0>
Let me guess... You're in the market
for a dream home, right?
That's no surprise—our unique modular
building style lets you put rooms together
to create the perfect home!
But...I'm so sorry. <sp:5:1:0>We're still not ready to
open for business.

<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Notice_01>Wait... <sp:5:0:0>It's you...
Talk_0148:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:TalkPositive_00>I'm going to become a great vai
like Mama.

And I'll meet a wonderful voe like Papa!
Talk_0040:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Look who it is! <sp:5:0:0>It sure has been a while.


You know, thanks to you, <clr:0000>Tarrey Town<clr:ffff> is
doing real good.

Nowadays,<sp:5:0:0> it's the kind of village that
welcomes folks from all over to come
live in peace.
Oh, and we have a daughter!<sp:5:1:0> Looks just
like her papa...<sp:5:1:0> She's wonderful...<sp:5:1:0>

<sp:3:0:2:0a01><snd:Sad_01>My little <sp:5:0:0>Mattison...
Talk_0149:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:LaughS_00>I hope you've been studying your Gerudo
less-sons, 'cause we're about to begin!

<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:TalkPositive>Ahem! <sp:5:1:0>Welcome to Mattison's
Gerudo quiz!
Talk_0041:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Sad_00>Sorry, we aren't ready to open for
business yet.

It's a shame we're so busy too. After all,
we haven't seen you for such a long time.

But right now, my husband and I must
prepare to send our daughter off.
Talk_0042:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I mentioned her earlier. We have a
daughter named <clr:0000>Mattison<clr:ffff>.

She's wonderful. All the best parts of me
and my wife, Rhondson.

But Mattison is... <sp:5:1:0>Well, soon she's going
to leave and move to my wife's birthplace,
<clr:0000>Gerudo Town<clr:ffff>.
Talk_0043:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>The Gerudo have a law that says they
can't associate with men until they
come of age, you see.
I mean, it's fine while they're very young,
but when they start to become more...
aware of the world around them...
someone comes from <clr:0000>Gerudo Town<clr:ffff> to
pick them up.

I've been told that, for a Gerudo,
spending time in Gerudo Town is
an honor.
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>And Mattison does seem to be looking
forward to it. Anyway, I want to give her
a big send-off, but...
I...I didn't realize this would be so hard
for me.

<sp:3:0:2:0701>Ah, sorry you had to listen to me go on
and on like that. I really should get back
to the <clr:0000>job site<clr:ffff> soon.
<sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:Sad>I want to spend more time with my little
girl before she has to leave, but I have so
much work to do.
My wife has her hands full too, what with
preparing Mattison for the move. She's so
busy, she can't even take work requests.
Mostly I just wish someone could <clr:0000>spend
time with Mattison<clr:ffff> so she wouldn't
feel so lonely.
Talk_0044:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Hey, mister! Are you a friend of Papa's?


He was gone for a long time, but now he's
back home!<sp:0:4:0>I'm gonna be moving soon, so I gotta
make sure I play with papa and every-son
else a whole bunch while I still can!
Talk_0045:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>It won't be long before I move!


So you know what I'm gonna do? I'm
gonna play with Papa, Mama, and
every-son in the village while I have time.
Talk_0046:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Oh, it's you.<sp:0:4:0>You were kind enough to visit our shop,
and yet I haven't been able to show you
much hospitality. I'm sorry about that.<sp:5:0:0>
You know, here at <clr:0000>Hudson Construction<clr:ffff>,
we like to say...<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0800><sp:0:2:2:7d00>"It's son and done!"<sp:0:2:2:6400><sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0701>And here I am, president of the company.
I'm supposed to be strong and decisive.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0a00>But when it comes to my own <clr:0000>child<clr:ffff>, I feel
so...<sp:5:0:0>unsure about things.
Talk_0152:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>If only I had <clr:0000><sp:2:e:44:3e0049006300680069006b006100720061004300680061006c006c0065006e0067006500300031005f0048006900640061006d006100720069004e0075006d00ffff00cd> sundelions<clr:ffff>, then I'd be
able to dye the balloon a bright yellow.

<sp:3:0:2:0c01>But...I don't know where I'm going to
get them from.
Talk_0047:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I've got sooo much to learn. I've gotta
pay close attent-son to my less-sons.
Talk_0153:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I need to finish this up quick. It'd be awful
if Mattison got sick from being out in all
this rain.
Talk_0049:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:QuestionNormal>Good morning is "sav'otta"...<sp:5:0:0> Good day
is "sav'aaq"...

And goodbye is...
Talk_0159: <sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy_01>Wooow! I feel like I've turned into a bird!
Talk_1005:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00><snd:Wakeup>It's my *yawn* bedtime...<sp:5:1:0> <sp:5:1:0>We can have a
conversat-son tomorrow...
Talk_0051:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>I'm doing all this studying because I'm
moving to Mama's hometown soon.

<sp:3:0:2:0801>Where she's from, there's this amazing
language called <clr:0000>Gerudo<clr:ffff>.

I want to teach every-son in the village to
speak it too, so I've made it my miss-son
to memorize as many words as I can!
Talk_0052:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Hey, would you like to learn some words
too, mister? If so, your timing couldn't
be better.
Talk_1008:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00><snd:Wakeup>I'm sooo tired. I'm not giving up
my miss-son. I'll look for <clr:0000>sundelions<clr:ffff>
again tomorrow...
Talk_1009:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Sleep>I'll turn into a bird...fly through the air...
find the <clr:0000>sundelions<clr:ffff>... *mumbling*
Talk_0161:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_00>Ah, sorry about that.<sp:5:1:0> You know, you really
were a big help to me. Honestly, I can't
thank you enough.
Those sundelions were pretty valuable,
weren't they? Well, as a way of saying
thank you...please, take this.
